Death toll from bird flu in China reaches 13
+The Associated Press : The death toll from the H7N9 bird flu virus in China increased to 13 on Sunday.
In addition, 11 new cases were reported, bringing the country's total number to 60. Two of the new cases were reported from central Henan province, which had been previously unaffected.
Health officials believe the virus is spreading through direct contact with infected birds.
Read more: http://bit.ly/132M1cZ
Follow the latest on the outbreak at BreakingNews.com: http://bit.ly/132MOe5
Photo: A vendor, above, washed a chicken stall in a poultry market in Hefei, China, shortly before it was due to be closed Thursday. (AFP – Getty Images)﻿

China’s surging bird flu – bring in the veterinarians
PULLMAN, Wash. – The new bird #influenza spreading in #China underscores the need for strong ties between #veterinarians and human-health specialists, said Guy Palmer, director of #WSU's Paul G. Allen School for Global Animal Health.

Genetic Code Shows Bird Flu In China Spread Between People
"When a new strain of bird flu cropped up in China last winter, the billion-dollar question was whether the deadly virus could transmit between people.
Now, Chinese scientists offer the first clear evidence that the bird flu is indeed contagious, although only slightly."
Read more from +NPR: http://goo.gl/Sn45pr﻿
